{"step_by_step_thinking": "Insulin-dependent diabetes in a pregnant woman can lead to complications such as macrosomia (large baby), pre-eclampsia, and neonatal hypoglycemia. To avoid these complications, it is often recommended to induce labor or perform a cesarean section before the due date. The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) recommends delivery between 37 and 39 weeks for women with preexisting diabetes. Therefore, the closest option to this recommendation is 38 weeks.", "answer_choice": "B"}
